stories.title: A Bulgarian company sells a device that unlocks almost any car

stories.text:
I'm hiring engineers for a venture-funded tech startup in the bay area, as I & team have exhausted our personal connections.

What's the best approach to take with hiring?

Is it through platforms like Triplebyte or Linkedin Recruiter? Which is better?

Or is it through a recruiter that is paid a fee per hire?

Or is it through Angelist or a similar job board?

I'd appreciate it if you can share any experiences that you have. Thanks!
stories.title: Ask HN: Best way to hire engineers for a startup?
Kickit.dev – handle app version upgrades with ease

stories.text: We used to host Zoom meetings for open office hours with the open-source contributors and end-users. I notice more and more people start to hold audio chats on Twitter Spaces. Do you think it is a better choice for community engagement?
stories.title: Ask HN: Is Twitter Space a better choice for community engagement?
